channel.title: STORAGE on Ventus Docs
channel.description: Recent content in STORAGE on Ventus Docs

item.title: Object Storage
item.description: On this page, you can find an explanation of what is Object Storage in Cloud Console, how to create, delete buckets and instructions for other steps to manage an Object Storage in the Cloud Console. Table of contents Introduction Use Object Storage with Python API Creating connection Listing buckets Creating bucket Creating object Listing bucket content Changing object ACL Generating object download-URL Deleting object Deleting bucket Use Object Storage with S3 Browser Introduction The Cloud Console Object Storage makes it possible to store data simply and cost-effectively.

item.title: Object Storage Credentials
item.description: On this page, you can find an explanation of how to create, delete and instructions for other steps to manage an Object Storage Credentials in the Cloud Console. Table of contents Object Storage page Create Object Storage credentials Show secret key Re-generate secret key Delete Object Storage credentials Object Storage page To get to the Object Storage page, select the Storage from the VIRTUAL DATACENTER block in the side-bar menu and click the Object Storage TAB: On this page you can find all created Object Storage credentials in the current Project with their Headers, Create button, Search bar and Actions icon, which opens a list of available management actions for the selected Object Storage credentials: Actions icon opens the next list of available management actions:

item.title: Volumes
item.description: On this page, you can find an explanation of how to create, edit, delete Volumes and instructions for other steps to manage Volumes in the Cloud Console. Table of contents Volumes page Create Volume Attach Volume Detach Volume Edit Volume Extend Volume Delete Volume Volumes page To get to the Volumes page, select the Storage from the VIRTUAL DATACENTER block in the side-bar menu and click the Volumes TAB: On this page you can find all your own Volumes, created in the current Project, and the Volumes created during Cluster and VM creation, with their Headers, Create button, Search bar and Actions icon which opens a list of available management actions for the selected Volume: Actions icon opens the next list of available management actions:

item.title: VM's Volumes
item.description: On this page, you can find an explanation of how to manage Volumes related to the selected Virtual Machine in Cloud Console. Table of contents VM’s VOLUMES TAB Attach Volume Detach Volume Edit Volume Extend Volume VM’s VOLUMES TAB To find all Volumes, related to the selected Virtual Machine, you need: open the Virtual Machines page - for this select the Virtual Machines from the VIRTUAL DATACENTER block in the side-bar menu: open the Virtual Machine details page - for this click on the Name of the corresponding Virtual Machine: open the VOLUMES page of this VM - for this click on the VOLUMES TAB: On this page you can find all Volumes, attached to the corresponding VM, with their Headers, Attach button, Search bar and Actions icon, which opens a list of available management actions for the selected Volume: Actions icon opens the next list of available management actions:

item.title: Snapshots
item.description: On this page, you can find an explanation of how to create, edit, delete Snapshots and how to create Volumes from the Snapshots in the Cloud Console. Table of contents Snapshots page Create Snapshot Create Volume from Snapshot Edit Snapshot Delete Snapshot Snapshots page To get to the Snapshots page, select Storage from the VIRTUAL DATACENTER block in the side-bar menu and click the Snapshots TAB: On this page you can find all created Snapshots with their Headers, Create button, Search bar and Actions icon, which opens a list of available management actions for the selected Snapshot: Actions icon opens the next list of available management actions:

item.title: VM's Snapshots
item.description: On this page, you can find an explanation of how to manage Snapshots, related to the selected Virtual Machine, in the Cloud Console. Table of contents VM’s SNAPSHOTS TAB Create Snapshot Edit Snapshot Delete Snapshot VM’s SNAPSHOTS TAB To find all Snapshots, related to the selected Virtual Machine, you need: open the Virtual Machines page - for this select the Virtual Machines from the VIRTUAL DATACENTER block in the side-bar menu: open the Virtual Machine details page - for this click on the Name of the corresponding Virtual Machine: open the SNAPSHOTS page of this VM - for this click on the SNAPSHOTS TAB: On this page you can find all Snapshots, related to the corresponding VM, with their Headers, Create button, Search bar and Actions icon, which opens a list of available management actions for the selected Snapshot: Actions icon opens the next list of available management actions:
